sen.j: 北条 高広（きたじょう たかひろ、永正14年（1517年？） - 天正15年（1587年？））は、戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Takahiro KITAJO (1517? – 1587?) was a military commander during the Sengoku (Warring States) Period in Japan.
Takahiro KITAJO (1517? – 1587?) was a military commander during the Sengoku (Warring States) period in Japan.
Takahiro KITAJO (1517? – 1587?) was a military commander during the Sengoku (Warring States) period in Japan.

sen.j: 長尾氏（上杉氏）に仕えた。
sen.e: He served the Nagao clan (Uesugi clan).
He served the Nagao clan (Uesugi clan).
He served the Nagao clan (Uesugi clan).

sen.j: 安田広春（安田広春）の子（養子で実父は北条高定とも）。
sen.e: Child of Hiroharu KITAJO (Hiroharu YASUDA) (his actual father Takatei ? (高定) KITAJO was also an adopted-son.)
sen.cmt: 北条Original wiki listing is different
sen.e: He was the child of Hiroharu KITAJO (Hiroharu YASUDA) (his actual father, Takatei ? (高定) KITAJO, was also an adopted son).
He was the child of Hiroharu KITAJO (Hiroharu YASUDA); however, it was also said that he was an adopted son and his real father was Takatei KITAJO.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 北条景広・北条高広（父と同名）・女子（沼田朝憲妻）の父。
sen.e: Was father of: Kagehiro KITAJO, Takahiro KITAJO (same name as father) and a daughter (wife of Tomonori NUMATA).
He was the father of Kagehiro KITAJO, Takahiro KITAJO (who had the father's name) and a daughter (the wife of Tomonori NUMATA).
He was the father of Kagehiro KITAJO, Takahiro KITAJO (same as his father's name) and a daughter (the wife of Tomonori NUMATA).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 丹後守・安芸守。
sen.e: Governor of Tango and Aki.
He was the governor of Tango and Aki.
He was the governor of Tango and Aki provinces.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.cmt: スペース挿入小文字に

sen.j: 北条氏（きたじょうし）は安芸国の毛利氏と同族であり、血筋の上では安芸毛利氏より正嫡である。
sen.e: The Kitajo clan is part of the same family as the Mori clan of Aki Province. At the head of the lineage is the main family: the Aki Mori clan.
The Kitajo clan is part of the same family as the Mori clan of Aki Province; at the head of the lineage is the main family, the Aki Mori clan.
The Kitajo clan is in the same family line as the Mori clan of Aki Province, but the Kitajo clan is in the line of heir unlike the Aki Mori clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その誇りからか、代々の当主は家祖大江広元の広の字を用いている。
sen.e: Be it because of this pride, family heads in following generations used the Hiro "広" character which appears in the name of the clan's forebear; Oe no Hiromoto.
Given such a position of pride, the family heads in succeeding generations used the Hiro "広" character, which appears in the name of the clan's forebear, Oe no Hiromoto.
Given such a position of pride, the heads of the family in succeeding generations used the Hiro "広" character, which appears in the name of the clan's forebear, Oe no Hiromoto 大江広元.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: なお、越後の毛利一族には安田氏がおり、高広の父（養父）の広春はもともとは安田氏の出身で、北条輔広の養子となり、北条氏と安田氏の当主を兼任していた。
sen.e: Furthermore, the Yasuda clan was part of the Echigo branch of the Mori household and, Takahiro`s father (adoptive father) Hiroharu originally hailed from the Ando clan. Upon being adopted by Sukehiro KITAJO, the role of the head of the Kitajo and Yasuda clans were held concurrently.
sen.cmt: きたじょうすけひろ 北条輔広http://www.asahi-net.or.jp/~jt7t-imfk/webwho/whoswho07.html
sen.e: Furthermore, the Yasuda clan was part of the Echigo branch of the Mori household, and Takahiro's father (adoptive father) Hiroharu originally hailed from the Ando clan; upon being adopted by Sukehiro KITAJO, the roles as heads of the Kitajo and Yasuda clans were held concurrently.

Furthermore, the Yasuda clan was part of the Echigo branch of the Mori household, from which Takahiro's adoptive father Hiroharu hailed and was adopted by Sukehiro KITAJO; accordingly, Hiroharu concurrently held the roles of heads of the Kitajo and Yasuda clans.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 享禄3年（1530年）ごろ、広春が没し、北条氏の家督は高広、安田氏の家督は安田景元が継承した。
sen.e: With the death around 1530 of Hiroharu, the role of Kitajo family head was inherited byTakahiro whereas, the role of Yasuda family head passed to Kagemoto YASUDA.
With the death of Hiroharu in around 1530, the role of the Kitajo family head was inherited by Takahiro, whereas the role of the Yasuda family head passed to Kagemoto YASUDA.
When Hiroharu died around 1530, the role of the Kitajo family head was inherited by Takahiro, whereas the role of the Yasuda family head passed to Kagemoto YASUDA.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 高広は武将としての器量に優れ、「器量・骨幹、人に倍して無双の勇士」と謳われた（北越軍談）。
sen.e: As a warrior, Takahiro was blessed with good looks: "A peerless brave warrior with double the physique and looks of others " it was said (Hokuetsu War Stories).
As a warrior, Takahiro was blessed with good looks: "A peerless, brave warrior with twice the physique and looks of others," it was said (Hokuetsu War Stories).
Takahiro was a competent warrior, which was said 'A peerless, brave warrior with twice the ability and the physique of others' (Hokuetsu War Stories).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 事実、上杉軍団の行く所、彼の武名は大きく轟いたという。
sen.e: In fact, wherever the Uesugi troops went, there military feats were well known it is said.
In fact, wherever the Uesugi troops went, it was said that their military feats were well known.
It was said that wherever the Uesugi troops went, their military feats were well known indeed.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、家中一の粗忽の者で、主君の上杉謙信も気を揉むことが多かったといわれている。
sen.e: However, as the whole family was at fault, the head of the clan Kenshin UESUGI was said to have been burdened with many worries.
However, as the whole family was at fault, the head of the clan Kenshin UESUGI was said to have been burdened with many worries.
Yet, he was the hastiest person among the family members, and the head of the clan Kenshin UESUGI was said to have been burdened with many worries.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: また、上述の経緯から、安田氏の景元とは特に対立関係にあったようで、高広の謀反を謙信に報告したのは景元である。
sen.e: Also, following the complications outlined above, in particular Kagemoto of the Yasuda clan met with antagonism and,Takahiro`s treason was reported to Kenshin by Kagemoto.
Also, following the complications outlined above, Kagemoto of the Yasuda clan, in particular, met with antagonism, and Takahiro's act of treason was reported to Kenshin by Kagemoto.
Following the complications outlined above, Kagemoto was antagonistic to Kagemoto of the Yasuda clan, in particular, and it iwas he who reported Takahiro's act of treason to Kenshin.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 高広は越後の戦国大名である長尾氏に仕え、長尾為景・長尾晴景に仕え、戦功を積んでいたが、天文 (元号)23年（1554年）、長尾氏に敵対する甲斐国の武田信玄と通じて北条城において主君・上杉謙信に反乱。
sen.e: Takahiro served the Nagao clan daimyo (feudal warlords): Tamekage NAGAO and Harukage NAGAO with substantial valor but, in 1554, shifted sides to that of Harunobu TAKEDA of Kai Province (who was antagonistic towards the Nagao clan) and rebelled against Kenshin UESUGI the lord of Kitajo castle.

Takahiro served the Nagao clan daimyo (feudal warlords) Tamekage NAGAO and Harukage NAGAO with substantial valor but, in 1554, shifted sides to that of Harunobu TAKEDA of Kai Province (who was antagonistic towards the Nagao clan) and rebelled against Kenshin UESUGI, the lord of Kitajo Castle.

Takahiro served the Nagao clan, a feudal warlord in Echigo province, then served Tamekage NAGAO and Harukage NAGAO with distinguished war service, but in 1554, shifted sides to that of Shingen TAKEDA of Kai Province who was antagonistic towards the Nagao clan, and rebelled against Kenshin UESUGI at the Kitajo Castle.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかしこれは翌年、長尾軍の反攻を受けて降伏した。
sen.e: However, the following year he capitulated in the face of a counter-offensive from the Nagao forces.
However, the following year he capitulated in the face of a counter-offensive from the Nagao forces.
But in the following year, he capitulated in the face of a counter-offensive from the Nagao forces.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後は景虎（上杉謙信）に再び仕え、奉行として活躍した。
sen.e: Afterwards he served Kagetora (Kenshin UESUGI) once again as an administrator.
Subsequently, he served Kagetora (Kenshin UESUGI) again as an administrator.
Subsequently, he served Kagetora (Kenshin UESUGI) for the second time as an administrator.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 永禄6年（1563年）には上野国厩橋城主に任命され、関東方面の政治や軍事を任されたのである。
sen.e: In 1563, he was commissioned as lord of Umayabashi castle in Kozuke Province and was in charge of Kanto district political and military matters.
In 1563, he was commissioned as lord of Umayabashi Castle in Kozuke Province and was in charge of political and military matters in the Kanto district.
In 1563, he was commissioned as lord of Umayabashijo Castle in Kozuke Province and was entrusted with political and military matters in the Kanto district.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: これを見ても、高広が武将として優れていたのがうかがえるが、永禄10年（1567年）、今度は北条氏康に通じて再び謙信に背く。
sen.e: We can take it from this that Takahiro was an excellent military commander however, this time in 1567 he once again disobeyed Kenshin by swapping sides to Ujiyasu HOJO.
Thus we can assume that Takahiro was an excellent military commander, but this time, in 1567, he again disobeyed Kenshin by changing his allegiance and siding with Ujiyasu HOJO.
Thus we can assume that Takahiro was an excellent military commander; and now in 1567, he disobeyed Kenshin for the second time by changing his allegiance and siding with Ujiyasu HOJO.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかしこれは翌年、上杉氏と後北条氏との間で越相同盟が結ばれたため、高広は北条氏政の仲介のもと、再び上杉氏に帰参し、以後は上杉氏の家臣として忠実に仕えた。
sen.e: However, with the conclusion of the Etsuso Alliance the following year between the Uesugi and Gohojo clans, thanks to the intercession of Ujimasa HOJO, Takahiro was able to return into the service of the Uesugi clan and from then on served the Uesugi clan as a loyal retainer.

However, with the conclusion of the Etsuso Alliance the following year between the Uesugi and Gohojo clans, thanks to the intercession of Ujimasa HOJO, Takahiro was able to return into the service of the Uesugi clan and from then on served the Uesugi clan as a loyal retainer.

However, with the conclusion of the Etsuso Alliance between the Uesugi and Gohojo clans in the following year, Takahiro was able to return to the service of the Uesugi clan thanks to the intercession of Ujimasa HOJO, and from then on served the Uesugi clan as a loyal retainer.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 沼田氏で内紛が起こり、娘婿の朝憲が殺害されると、沼田氏の家臣団の求めに応じ、朝憲の父の沼田顕泰（万鬼斎）とその子の沼田景義を会津に追放している。
sen.e: Internal conflict erupted within the Numata clan with the murder of the adopted son Choken (?), and at the urging of a group of vassals, Choken`s father Akiyasu NUMATA (Mankisai?) and child Kageyoshi NUMATA were exciled to Aizu.

Internal conflict erupted within the Numata clan with the murder of the adopted son Choken (?), and at the urging of a group of vassals, Choken's father, Akiyasu NUMATA (Mankisai?), and son, Kageyoshi NUMATA, were exiled to Aizu.

Internal conflict erupted within the Numata clan with the murder of Choken, the hustand of Numata clan's daughter, and at the urging of a group of vassals, Choken's father, Akiyasu NUMATA (Mankisai), and Akiyasu's son, Kageyoshi NUMATA, were exiled to Aizu.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

tit.e: The Otate Revolt and the fall
tit.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 天正2年（1574年）に隠居して大胡城へ入り、家督を嫡男の景広に譲った。
sen.e: In 1574 he retired to Ogo castle and handed over the role of head of the family to his eldest son Kagehiro.
In 1574, he retired to Ogo Castle and handed over the role of family head to his eldest son, Kagehiro.
In 1574, he retired to Ogojo Castle and handed over the headship to his eldest son, Kagehiro.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 天正6年（1578年）、謙信が没すると出家し安芸入道芳林と号す。
sen.e: In 1578 with the death of Kenshin, he enters the priesthood in Aki Province and adopts the name Yoshibayashi.
In 1578, with the death of Kenshin, he entered the priesthood in Aki Province and adopted the name Yoshibayashi.
When Kenshin died in 1578, he entered the priesthood in Aki Province and adopted the name Yoshibayashi.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 御館の乱では、子の景広と共に上杉景虎を支持して上杉景勝と戦うが、北条城などを落とされ、景広は戦死し、自身は武田勝頼のもとへ走った（実父とされる高定も景勝に殺害されたといわれる）。
sen.e: In the Otate Revolt together with his son Kagehiro, he supports Kagetora UESUGI in battles against Kagekatsu UESUGI but, Kitajo castle and elsewhere fall, Kagehiro is killed and he himself retreats to Katsuyori TAKEDA (it is also said that his real father Takatei ? (高定) was also killed by Kagekatsu).

In the Otate Revolt together with his son Kagehiro, he supported Kagetora UESUGI in battles against Kagekatsu UESUGI, but Kitajo Castle and other sites fell; Kagehiro was killed, and he retreated to Katsuyori TAKEDA (it is also said that his real father, Takatei ? (高定), was killed by Kagekatsu).

In the Ontate Revolt, together with his son Kagehiro, he supported Kagetora UESUGI and fought Kagekatsu UESUGI; however, Kitajo-jo Castle and other sites fell, Kagehiro was killed, and he retreated to Katsuyori TAKEDA (it is also said that his real father, Takatei, was killed by Kagekatsu).
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: その後、勝頼の取り成しで景勝に仕えた（あるいは武田氏の滅亡後に滝川一益に仕え、一益の没落後に後北条氏に仕えたとも）というが、晩年の消息は詳しくわかっていない。
sen.e: It is said that afterwards, Katsuyori mediated and he served Kagekatsu (alternatively, after the downfall of the Takeda clan he served Kazumasa (Ichimasu?) TAKIGAWA and after Kazumasa's downfall, he then served the Gohojo clan) but, little is known about his latter years.

It is said that afterwards Katsuyori mediated and served Kagekatsu (alternatively, after the downfall of the Takeda clan he served Kazumasa (Ichimasu?) TAKIGAWA, but after Kazumasa's downfall he served the Gohojo clan), but little is definite in regard to his latter years.

It is said that afterwards he served Kagekatsu through the mediation of Katsuyori (alternatively, after the downfall of the Takeda clan, he served Kazumasa TAKIGAWA, but after Kazumasa's downfall, he served the Gohojo clan), but details are unknown in regard to his latter years.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: なお、子には景広の他にも同名の｢北条高広｣がおり、彼は上杉氏に帰参したものの越後の所領を取り戻すことはできず没落したという。
sen.e: Besides Kagehiro he also had another child bearing his own name "Takahiro KITAJO". It is said that Takahiro (Jnr.) reentered service with the Uesugi clan but failed to regain territory lost in Echigo and was ruined.

Besides Kagehiro, he also had another child bearing his own name, "Takahiro KITAJO"; it is said that Takahiro (the junior) re-entered service with the Uesugi clan but failed to regain the territory lost in Echigo and was ruined.

Besides Kagehiro, he also had another child 'Takahiro KITAJO' having the same name as his own--It is said that Takahiro (the junior) returned to service of the Uesugi clan but failed in regaining the territory lost in Echigo and fell.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 目立たぬよう、白地にクロオオアリを一匹書いた物を使用したとされる。
sen.e: A single plain black ant (Camponotus japonicus) motif was used to avoid standing out.
A single plain black ant (Camponotus japonicus) motif was used in order to avoid standing out.
A single plain Japanese carpenter ant (Camponotus japonicus) motif was used in order to avoid being loud.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 家紋は毛利氏と同じ一文字三ツ星。
sen.e: The family crest is identical with the Mori clan: a single line and 3 stars.
The family crest is identical to that of the Mori clan: a single line and three stars.
The family crest is identical to that of the Mori clan: a single line and three stars.
